p: While in other countries, such as Brazil and others, the movements explained how the national dialogues were heavily biased. In those contexts, invitations for the national dialogues were very selective and were obviously addressed to those who shared the vision of agribusiness rather than the vision of the human right to food in the broader human rights framework. For this reason, movements in such countries had decided not to take part in the respective national dialogues and to convene other independent dialogues in their own countries.
